explanations.machine learning: The paper discusses the use of Machine Learning (ML) techniques to improve credit risk assessment.
explanations.deep learning: The paper mentions Deep Learning (DL) techniques as part of the AI methods used in credit risk assessment.
explanations.neural network: Neural networks are implied as part of the deep learning techniques discussed.
explanations.representation learning: Representation learning is a core part of deep learning methods used in the paper.
explanations.classification: Classification is a common task in credit risk assessment, likely addressed by the ML/DL methods.
explanations.regression: Regression may be used for predicting credit risk scores or probabilities.
explanations.support vector machine: SVM is a common ML method that could be used in credit risk modeling.
explanations.decision tree: Decision trees are a fundamental ML method likely used in credit risk assessment.
explanations.clustering: Clustering may be used for segmenting customers or detecting patterns in credit data.
explanations.feature learning: Feature learning is inherent in deep learning approaches discussed.
explanations.feature representation: Feature representation is a key aspect of the learning methods used.
explanations.backpropagation: Backpropagation is the standard training method for neural networks mentioned.
explanations.rectified linear unit: ReLU is a common activation function in deep neural networks.
explanations.sigmoid: Sigmoid is another common activation function in neural networks.
explanations.tanh: Tanh is a common activation function in neural networks.
explanations.hidden layer: Hidden layers are fundamental components of deep neural networks.
explanations.convolutional neural network: CNNs may be used for processing certain types of financial data.
explanations.recurrent neural network: RNNs are mentioned as part of the DL techniques for sequential data.
explanations.long short-term memory: LSTM is a type of RNN likely used for sequential financial data.
explanations.autoencoder: Autoencoders may be used for feature learning in credit risk data.
explanations.denoising autoencoder: A variant of autoencoder that could be used for robust feature learning.
explanations.deep belief network: DBNs are mentioned as part of the deep learning approaches.
explanations.DBM: Deep Boltzmann Machines are related to deep belief networks.
explanations.restricted Boltzmann machine: RBMs are building blocks of deep belief networks.
explanations.dropout regularization: Dropout is a common regularization technique in deep learning.
explanations.unsupervised pre-train: Unsupervised pre-training is mentioned as part of the learning approaches.
